H0.text: Glaciers melt and form rivers is a rapid change that shapes Earth's surface.

H1.text: Wind weathers rocks into sand is a rapid change that shapes Earth's surface, in contrast to slower geological processes.

H2.text: Earthquakes move land and rocks, describing a rapid change among processes that shape Earth's surface, some of which are slow and others rapid.

H3.text: Rivers carry sediment and build deltas is a rapid change that shapes Earth's surface.

A4.text: Earthquakes are caused mostly by the rupture of geological faults.

A5.text: Ground rupture is a visible breaking and displacement of the Earth's surface along the trace of the fault, which may be of the order of several meters in the case of major earthquakes.
